solution_line_template: She drinks {daily_consumption} bottle a day and there are {bottles_per_case} bottles in a case so a case will last {bottles_per_case}/{daily_consumption} = <<{bottles_per_case}/{daily_consumption}={days_per_case}>>{days_per_case} days

She needs enough to last her {desired_duration_days} days and 1 case will last her {days_per_case} days so she needs {desired_duration_days}/{days_per_case} = <<{desired_duration_days}/{days_per_case}={num_cases_needed}>>{num_cases_needed} cases
Each case is on sale for ${cost_per_case} and she needs {num_cases_needed} cases so that's {cost_per_case}*{num_cases_needed} = $<<{cost_per_case}*{num_cases_needed}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
